page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our block contains the North and Central parts of Dunfermline. Most of Central Dunfermline is commercial and residential, however there is also a great amount of farmland and open space. One of the town's main features is its large abbey and the palace ruins which lie beside it. The palace used to be the home of the kings and queens of Scotland. The town owes much to Andrew Carnegie, a man born here in the nineteenth century who made millions of pounds in America and then returned to give Dunfermline a library, a park and many other useful amenities. Dunfermline also has a Sheriff court and a large Police Station. It is changing rapidly. A new shopping centre is being constructed and a dual carriageway is being built through the
